page.title: 06Ecology 1: Animals
page.content: The area is managed grassland with some open common. The few tracts of woodland are mainly small shelter- belts. Marshland is common in the valley bottoms; heather and whins on the upland moors. There are many footpaths including the north-south Cumbria Way part of which passes through the area from Greenhead to Potts Gill. all paths are well walked and maintained. Pollution is low but people and stock are disturbed by aircraft on low-flying training flights. Rainfall is high and snow must often be cleared from roads in winter before people can get to work or to feed stock. Resident and breeding animals include badger, bat, fox, hare, field & wood mouse, mink, mole, rabbit, shrew, red squirrel, stoat & weasel. The roe deer is a visitor (not breeding in area).
